project.name: Cassandra data analytics demo
project.description: Time series IoT data ingestion into Cassandra using the Kaa platform
project.details:
WARNING: This application was last verified against Kaa platform version 0.9.0. Some functionality may be broken or unavailable. You are still welcome to download the sources, tinker with them, and contribute back your bugfixes :)

This sample application based on Raspberry Pi and DHT11 collects temperature measurements from a sensor and uploads it to Cassandra DB using Kaa.
Please review the webinar below for hands-on experience based on an earlier version of the Kaa platform.


Installation

1. Get Rasberry Pi 2 Model B, DHT 11 sensor and 3 Male-Male jumper wires.
2. Install third-party components for C SDK using this guide.
3. Install the WiringPi library. 
$ git clone git://git.drogon.net/wiringPi
$ cd wiringPi
$ ./build
4. Connect wires using the following schema:
Connect DHT11 pin 1 (left) to Raspberry PI pin 7 (GPIO 4)
Connect DHT11 pin 2 (middle) to Raspberry PI pin 1 (VCC)
Connect DHT11 pin 3 (right) to Raspberry PI pin 14 (GND)


5. Download the source code by clicking the "Source" button on the left. Unpack the downloaded archive and run the application using the following command in the console: 
$ ./build.sh deploy
6. Observe console output. 
Data collection demo started
Going to add 1th log record: { id: 'Sensor 1', region: 'Region 1', model: 'DHT11', val: 25 }
Going to add 2th log record: { id: 'Sensor 1', region: 'Region 1', model: 'DHT11', val: 25 }
Going to add 3th log record: { id: 'Sensor 1', region: 'Region 1', model: 'DHT11', val: 25 }
Going to add 4th log record: { id: 'Sensor 1', region: 'Region 1', model: 'DHT11', val: 25 }
Going to add 5th log record: { id: 'Sensor 1', region: 'Region 1', model: 'DHT11', val: 25 }

Playing around

Make sure that the Kaa Sandbox is up and running. After starting the "Cassandra data analytics demo" application, you will receive log messages from the endpoint to the Kaa cluster. The Kaa cluster will persist those messages in a sandbox Cassandra database using a Cassandra log appender. You can explore the collected data by querying the sandbox Cassandra instance as follows: 
$ cqlsh
$ use kaa;
To see data stored in sensor_per_row table, use select statement: 
$ SELECT * FROM sensor_per_row;
To see data stored in sensor_per_date table, use select statement: 
$ SELECT * FROM sensor_per_date;
To see data stored in sensor_per_region table, use select statement: 
$ SELECT * FROM sensor_per_region;

For more details, please refer to our webinar video embeded above "Time series IoT data ingestion into Cassandra using Kaa IoT platform".
